formattedAddress: 103 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 103 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012-1243, USA

originalText.text: Pappas is hands down my absolute favorite spot for Brunch! They have incredible music and live entertainment and the energy overall is fire! You almost feel like you’re literally partying in Mykonos at one of their day clubs. Perfect for a special birthdays or fun brunch group as this is an elevated experience! The food was delicious with drinks to match. 10/10 would def recommend and can’t wait to go back!

You almost feel like you’re literally partying in Mykonos at one of their day clubs. Perfect for a special birthdays or fun brunch group as this is an elevated experience! The food was delicious with drinks to match. 10/10 would def recommend and can’t wait to go back!

originalText.text: Had a great evening at pappas enjoying the delicious food and tasty cocktails. The bartender was very attentive and the manager was very kind. He made sure I was seated in a timely manner & checked in throughout my stay. The energy in the room is electric

text.text: Had a great evening at pappas enjoying the delicious food and tasty cocktails. The bartender was very attentive and the manager was very kind. He made sure I was seated in a timely manner & checked in throughout my stay. The energy in the room is electric

originalText.text:
Pappas was recommended by friends who simply said,  it'll remind you of Mykonos.   And it surely does.  You start by arriving at a very usually crowded MacDougal street to an entry with dark curtains hiding the inside scene.   You're greeted by the first bar with white and blue decor throughout.  You can tell it's a lovely place with the loud music and remnants of sparklers. The crowd was mainly larger groups of women celebrating, birthdays, promotions, etc.
We ordered the Pappas chips which are thin slices of fried zucchini which were addictive and delicious.   The greek salad was fresh and nicely seasoned.   For dinner we had the whole fish, Tsipoura, which was like a sea breem, grilled to perfection.  We had a bunch of the Fig spritz drinks which were strong and tasty.  Overall, the food and drinks were very good.
The service left something to be desired as it took a while to get the waiters to get back to us for additional drinks.  At one point, we got up and went to the second bar in the back for additional drinks; our easier finally came back to us with the bill.
There is entertainment in the form of belly dancers and sparklers every 30-45 minutes which makes for a fun time to take out visitors who want some dinner entertainment.   The bar in the back has a DJ and feels like a small club after dinner, which was also fun.
Great food, fun ambiance, but needs more on the service side.   Definitely stop by once for the experience.

Location - 7
Service - 7
Quality - 9
Ambiance - 9

originalText.text: I celebrated a friend’s birthday here and the atmosphere was truly unique with sparklers flaming, music blaring, cocktail napkins flying and illuminated women with wings/plate of lit candles on their heads dancing throughout the entire evening. Their the Hera Spritz was refreshing and their spicy feta and grilled octopus appetizers were delicious. I’m unlikely to return here just for the food but had a great time overall!

text.text: I celebrated a friend’s birthday here and the atmosphere was truly unique with sparklers flaming, music blaring, cocktail napkins flying and illuminated women with wings/plate of lit candles on their heads dancing throughout the entire evening. Their the Hera Spritz was refreshing and their spicy feta and grilled octopus appetizers were delicious. I’m unlikely to return here just for the food but had a great time overall!

originalText.text:
I visited Pappas for the first time and let me just say, I WILL be coming back! Upon arrival, I was greeted by the most lovely hostess who was INCREDIBLY kind and very quick with seating us. The entertainment had just started to arrive when we did so we had some time to chit chat and take photos. But once the entertainment started? That was something I’ll never forget. Definitely 10/10 vibes. Now let’s talk food, as someone who does not eat seafood I was pleasantly surprised that there were several things to choose from that did not include seafood. Everything we had was unbelievably delicious. here is everything we got on the menu:

Appetizers:
Greek Spreads
Pappas Chips

Entrees:
Croissant French Toast
Brined Half Roasted Chicken

Dessert:
Chocolate lava cake

Drinks:
Chios Margarita

If you love dressing up and taking pictures and eating yummy food and just overall having the time of your life, step into Pappas for the perfect Greek vibes
